text: Chamrao Parbat I (Hindi:चमराओ पर्वत I) is a mountain of the Garhwal Himalaya in Uttarakhand India. Chamrao Parbat I standing majestically at . It is 22nd highest located entirely within the Uttrakhand. Nanda Devi, is the highest mountain in this category. Chamrao Parbat I lies between the Mukut Parbat and Saraswati Parbat I. It lies on the India China border. It is located 9.9 km NW of Kamet and 5.3 km NNW lies Saraswati Parbat I . ==Glaciers and rivers== Near by glaciers and river Dakshini Chamrao glacier, Balbala glacier and Paschimi Kamet glacier all the glacier drain their water in the Saraswati river which then joins Alaknanda River near Mana village one of the main tributaries of Ganga river. ==Neighboring peaks== Neighboring peaks of Chamrao Parbat I: * Kamet: * Abi Gamin: * Mukut Parbat: * Saraswati Parbat I: * Balbala: ==See also== * List of Himalayan peaks of Uttarakhand ==References== Category:Mountains of Uttarakhand Category:Six-thousanders of the Himalayas Category:Geography of Chamoli district
title: Chamrao Parbat I
